Bullish Keynotes from Q2 conference delivering a strong holiday is our key focus.our operational transformation remains on trackOur digital channel represented 34% of total net salesNovember has historically represented nearly half of the sales for Q3 due to the fans gaming sales period, inclusive of the Black Friday selling periodSolidifying our capital availability further, we improved terms and increased our asset-based revolving credit facility to $1 billion in August, bringing our total liquidity to $2 billionwe opened our new Northeast regional distribution center. These developments are instrumental to our end-to-end transformational strategy and will help in the long-term control and protection from supply chain stresswe should benefit from our ongoing initiatives, including the increasing penetration and growth of our new owned brands, better market-based prices, more effective data-driven promotion and markdown strategy and supply chain and freight optimization.we are well-positioned to continue delivering on our transformation. We have the plan, the team and the capital to unlock our potential.Our in-stock rates are very solid. We're kind of at the same in stock rate in September pretty much that we were in June. So our teams have been working with their key national brand vendors remembering that while 20% of our penetration is owned brand, 80% is great national brands

Some of you asked why I posted about BBBY not being an essential but only nice to have retailer. Well let me ask this. Do you think if Walmart was to close all of its stores today would that have a big impact on consumers? Heck yeah especially a low income consumers and that impact would last for a while. But if BBBY was to go out of business would anyone miss it. NOPE! I am not saying BBBY is going out of business but it is not an essential retailer.

In Q1 2021, BBBY experienced 49.5% revenue growth while still increasing their gross margins to 32.4% through streamlining their operations. Additionally, their past 4 quarters of online sales have all had consecutive sales growth, breaking the seasonal trend and showing a great movement towards e-commerceQ2 should be even better for them as they have continued streamlining operations and expect to post over 2B in revenueBBBY has over 1.2 BILLION dollars of cash on-hand which they can use to continue moving towards e-commerce, create in-house products, and keep up growth. That cash alone is almost all of their ENTIRE market cap, not even including additional assets!!!Management has seen how undervalued their company is and has repurchased $130m shares to take advantage of this, with more share purchases to come. This shows how strong of a position they are in and how confident management is that their stock will increase in the future.r/wallstreetbets - BBBY: Undervalued and OvershortedEven though they are focusing on growth instead of profitability right now, BBBY’s P/E ratio is STILL in line with the S@P 500 averageOk... now that you understand how undervalued this company is, let me introduce to you the managementManagement:Management is one of, if not the most important factors for how well a company will do, and BBBY has some of the best management a company could hope forMark Tritton, the current CEO, has had over 30 years of experience in retail and oversaw Target’s streamlining and digital transformation as Executive VP. He has a clear vision for the company and has the industry connections and know-how to get it doneGustavo Arnal, the current CFO, has had experience turning around struggling companies before, most notably Avon. He has experience leading WBA’s global division and can help the company reach international marketsJohn Hartmann, the current COO, has had experience being the CEO of True Value Company which focused on hardwear. He also has experience working in Home Depot’s digital transformation program. He can help BBBY create some products of their own while guiding this digital pushThere are many more amazing people on the leadership team, but these 3 are the ones who stand out to me due to their unique abilities in certain fieldsManagement is what creates and directs a company’s visions and operations. With these 3 people on their team, BBBY covers all needed areas; Digital transformation, global supply-chains, hardwear production, and financial streamliningShorts:Despite being in such a good position, BBBY still has a 23% short interest left over from the whole meme stock surge in January(edited)

Sometimes logic doesn't work. Nor does anecdotal evidence. I lived near a Target store for decades. Prior to that it was a Gemco. I thought Gemco was fine, wasn't crazy about Target, but I shopped there. Was annoyed when they canceled the garden section. Never shopped at Walmart until recently, because where I live it's the only cheap alternative for groceries and certain other products. Neither Target nor Walmart impress me as a consumer, but they're making money. The stock market approves of Target and Walmart as if they are wonderful places to shop. No. They are boring and limited. Bed, Bath and Beyond always seemed like a better choice for certain products, but they screwed up somehow. It's a tricky world. BBBY might fight its way back by presenting the consumer with better choices than TGT and WMT, but the world doesn't always follow logic. Like I said, I thought Gemco was fine. They even had a gas station. Oh, wait. That was in the 1970s, Carter administration, oil embargo days...
